Article.Abstract: Merozoite surface protein 1 (MSP1) is the major protein component on the surface of the merozoite, the erythrocyte-invasive form of the malaria parasite Plasmodium. Present in all species of Plasmodium, it undergoes two distinct proteolytic maturation steps during the course of merozoite development that are essential for invasion of the erythrocyte. Antibodies specific for the C-terminal maturation product, MSP1-19, can inhibit erythrocyte invasion and parasite growth. This polypeptide is therefore considered to be one of the more promising malaria vaccine candidates. We describe here the crystal structure of recombinant MSP1-19 from P.falciparum (PfMSP1-19), the most virulent species of the parasite in humans, as a complex with the Fab fragment of the monoclonal antibody G17.12. This antibody recognises a discontinuous epitope comprising 13 residues on the first epidermal growth factor (EGF)-like domain of PfMSP1-19. Although G17.12 was raised against the recombinant antigen expressed in an insect cell/baculovirus system, it binds uniformly to the surface of merozoites from the late schizont stage, showing that the cognate epitope is exposed on the naturally occurring MSP1 polypeptide complex. Although the epitope includes residues that have been mapped to regions recognised by invasion-inhibiting antibodies studied by other workers, G17.12 does not inhibit erythrocyte invasion or MSP1 processing.
Article.ArticleTitle: Crystal structure of a Fab complex formed with PfMSP1-19, the C-terminal fragment of merozoite surface protein 1 from Plasmodium falciparum: a malaria vaccine candidate.
Article.Affiliations: Unité d'Immunologie Structurale (CNRS URA 2185), Département de Biologie Structurale et Chimie, Institut Pasteur, 25 rue du Dr. Roux, 75724 Paris, cedex 15, France.
Article.ArticleChemicalList: Antibodies, Monoclonal;Antibodies, Protozoan;Epitopes;Immunoglobulin Fab Fragments;Macromolecular Substances;Malaria Vaccines;Merozoite Surface Protein 1;Protein Subunits;Protozoan Proteins
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Animals; Antibodies, Monoclonal(chemistry); Antibodies, Protozoan(chemistry); Antigen-Antibody Reactions; Binding Sites, Antibody; Crystallography, X-Ray; Epitopes(chemistry); Erythrocytes(parasitology); Humans; Immunoglobulin Fab Fragments(chemistry); In Vitro Techniques; Macromolecular Substances; Malaria Vaccines(chemistry; immunology); Merozoite Surface Protein 1(chemistry; immunology); Models, Molecular; Plasmodium falciparum(immunology); Protein Structure, Tertiary; Protein Subunits(chemistry; immunology); Protozoan Proteins; Static Electricity

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 5 doses of 4x10^6 Sf9 cells at two-week intervals.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were immunized with Sf9 cells expressing recombinant PfMSP1-19 in 5 doses at two-week intervals. Mice were assayed for responsiveness by ELISA, and the best responder was sacrificed 3 days following a final booster injection.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Erythrocyte invasion experiments in vitro consistently showed that infection is not inhibited in the presence of the epitope-specific mAb G17.12 at 200 µg/ml concentration. The strain used is Palo Alto Marburg (PAM), which is derived from the Uganda Palo Alto.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 5 doses of 4x10^6 Sf9 cells at two-week intervals.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were immunized with Sf9 cells expressing recombinant PfMSP1-19 in 5 doses at two-week intervals. Mice were assayed for responsiveness by ELISA, and the best responder was sacrificed 3 days following a final booster injection.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope of Fab G17.12 on the C-terminal fragment of the P. falciparum merozoite surface protein 1 was determined from the crystal structure of the complex, solved by molecular replacement. In the structure, two antibody-antigen complexes are present that are slightly different in their antigen binding sites. Here, the second complex (chains D,E,F) is curated.

ThreeDimensionalStructureOfComplex.Comments: The antibody conformation is identical in both the bound and unbound state [PDB: 1B9W]. Contacts are provided in Figure 5 and Table 3.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 5 doses of 4x10^6 Sf9 cells at two-week intervals.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were immunized with Sf9 cells expressing recombinant PfMSP1-19 in 5 doses at two-week intervals. Mice were assayed for responsiveness by ELISA, and the best responder was sacrificed 3 days following a final booster injection.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope of Fab G17.12 on the C-terminal fragment of the P. falciparum merozoite surface protein 1 was determined from the crystal structure of the complex, solved by molecular replacement. In the structure, two antibody-antigen complexes are present that are slightly different in their antigen binding sites. Here, the first complex (chains A,B,C) is curated.

ThreeDimensionalStructureOfComplex.Comments: The antibody conformation is identical in both the bound and unbound state [PDB: 1B9W]. Contacts are provided in Figure 5 and Table 3.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 5 doses of 4x10^6 Sf9 cells at two-week intervals.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were immunized with Sf9 cells expressing recombinant PfMSP1-19 in 5 doses at two-week intervals. Mice were assayed for responsiveness by ELISA, and the best responder was sacrificed 3 days following a final booster injection.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Indirect immunofluorescence revealed that epitope-specific mAb G17.12 bound uniformly over the surface of the mature merozoite in late schizont stage underscoring the accessibility of this antigen to mAb in its native form. The strain used is Palo Alto Marburg (PAM), which is derived from the Uganda Palo Alto.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 5 doses of 4x10^6 Sf9 cells at two-week intervals.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were immunized with Sf9 cells expressing recombinant PfMSP1-19 in 5 doses at two-week intervals. Mice were assayed for responsiveness by ELISA, and the best responder was sacrificed 3 days following a final booster injection.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The dissociation constant for the interaction between the epitope-specific antibody and recombinant PfMSP1-19 was determined by indirect ELISA.
